comment: Accounting is a very hard class but Mr. Tsay is VERY helpful. This class you will need to study and be prepared for. He offers so many extra credit assignments and will also give extensions. He does use lockdown and webcam so make sure you are prepared for the test. He also has a TA that has study sessions that are very beneficial. Take him!

Good professor for a somewhat challenging class. Not always the best at explaining things and teaches sort of slow. Most of class is lecture with a few examples sometimes. if you cant teach yourself some of the material, take a different professor. Overall an easy class and an easy A. Tests and quizzes on lockdown.

Professor Tsay is absolutely amazing. He takes lecture notes on the screen as you write them down in class, and posts all lecture notes on D2L after each class period. Accounting in general is a very demanding class, so you definitely have to put work in outside the classroom. He offers A LOT of extra credit. If you put in the work, an easy A class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures

comment: BEST PROFESSOR EVER! i had a struggle learning the material and ended up with a 92. rounded grades extremely, my calculations said i should have had a C or D and got an A!!! always extended assignments when i asked even without a valid reason. TAKE THIS COURSE ONLINE WITH HIM! minimal work that can be challenging but will end up with a good grade!

Dr. Tsay is a really passionate teacher who genuinely cares about his students and accounting. Although I skipped class a lot (8ams are not for me), he was still a great lecturer and if you had questions he would happily answer them. The class in itself is very hard but if you use Chegg you'll be solid. Keep up with Connect assignments!

Definitely studied a lot but he offers tons of extra credit that helps a lot!! 1 in class test 1 online test and 1 cumulative final. A few quizzes in between as well. Worked hard to get my grade but I would 100% recommend taking him!

Super humble and caring. Wants students to do well and is willing to offer as much help as he can. Extra credit is available throughout the semester so be sure to keep an eye on that. Homework and in class assignments and quizzes are the best help to prepare for tests. 2 tests and cumulative final. Homework on every chapter and 3 quizzes total.

Dr Tsay is a nice guy. He really cares about his students and is always willing to help. His lectures are helpful and his tests aren't bad at all. He assigns LearnSmart for readings and quizzes are on Connect. You have to show up for at least 8 in class assignments to get full credit for them, but besides that attendance isn't mandatory

Dr Tsay is extremely knowledgable about accounting, and loves helping his students. He is not "easy", but there is no reason to not be able to pass this course. His method is to learn the content on LearnSmart (online guided reading and videos), attend his lectures to ask clarification, then do the homework, then take a quiz, all before the test!

Attendance isnt mandatory but you have to be present for 8 class assignments to get all the points. And his lectures are golden, so you need to go to class. Plenty of extra credit available. GREAT PROFESSOR! I am taking him for 2200 in spring. I showed up, took notes, did most HW, and got over a 100 in the class. He gives you everything you need.

Great professor that truly wants his students too do well. This class is a little tough but that's the nature of the class, and this prof helps ease that load all though he still requires work of you and a good bit of studying outside the class. 1 in class test and final and 1 online test, he also offers extra credit at multiple occasions.

ACCT2100 is a hard class, theres no skating around it. Dr. Tsay has given everyone all the information and resources to succeed in his class. Albeit, an extreme amount of assignments and material can be overwhelming at times, but it makes studying for the final that much easier. His exams are over the material taught, not some abstract trickery.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Super nice guy, but the homework he gives is WAY harder than necessary. He doesn't really explain how to do the problems but gives lots of other assignments and extra credit to make up for it. My advice: find someone in the class who really understands accounting and become their best friend, otherwise your going to struggle.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you do the assignments every week, you'll be on track to get an A in the class. He's so kind and willing to talk you through any questions you may have. He sees his own success in the successes of his students and I think that's really amazing. I took him for ACCT 2200 as well and would all over again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Take Dr. Tsay!! He's a very sweet man, provides lots of extra credit, and tries his best to make the subject as understandable as he can. If you go to class, pay attention, and put effort into homework and studying, this class isn't as bad as it's made out to be. Definitely recommend him!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Typical class. Show up take notes, do connect homework, then test. Very helpful guy. If you study hard, tests are very simple. Doesn't try to trick you.

Dr. Tsay clearly lectures about what will be on the tests. He gives several in class assignments, homework grades, exam wrappers, and various other small grades to help balance your grade with three exams. Sit in the front, because he can be hard to understand occasionally, but he does his best to fully explain. I got an A, and would take again.

He helped write the book we use and really knows what hes doing. He makes it very easy to understand as long as you listen and do the homework. Put in some effort and you will do great. He LOVES accounting and it shows. Probably my favorite professor yet!

Professor Tsay is really great and very knowledgeable about the subject. The material can be difficult to grasp, but he's always willing to go over the information with you and see if he can help you understand it better. I wish all my professors were as methodical and easy to follow as he is.

Okay so this is the hardest class I've ever taken, but I don't think it was the professor's fault. Make sure you watch ALL the lectures and take good notes from the get go. I thought I was going to fail out, but my boss convinced me to stay in the course and I came out with a B! He gives extra credit. Make sure you do the learnsmart assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I have had Dr. Tsay for 2100 and 2200 and received an A in both classes. He is an excellent professor and easy to talk to. He is always welcoming to teach you through email and office hours. He is very good about responding to emails in a timely matter. His tests can be tough but his practice questions help a ton! I totally recommend him to anyone!

Taken him for 2100 and 2200, got an A in both. his accent doesn't bother me at all. You will have to put effort into this course, that is just the nature of it. Professor Tsay can be a bit wordy when explaining things but he is very knowledgable and cares for his students. He is very organized, and responds emails well. A solid acc choice

Amazing professor. Teaches materials very well, goes in depth. Lots of points to make up for bad test grade. Lots of homework. Such a great professor. Gotta work hard though, how it should be. Gives lots of practice quizzes and problems. Definitely had to work hard for my A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Tsay knows what he is talking about. The class itself is hard and tests count for 15%, 20%, and 25% of you're grade. There is homework assignments due every week but they are bearable. He is a good professor, but be ready to actually have to learn.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Tsay at times is very hard to understand and does not do a great job of letting you  know exactly what material you need to understand. Reading before and after class to make sure you grasp the material is a HUGE help to your success. You will have to teach yourself a lot. Tons of extra credit available that helps in the end. Work hard.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Tsay is a great professor. He does write notes in class which are helpful for tests. He explains the work very well. Attendance isn't mandatory but you may want to attend because at the end of each chapter he gives in class assignments which you will get 100% regardless. This assignments are a good way to score extra credit.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: TAKE HIM! This is a hard subject, but he is the most adorable and funny old man. There are 3 tests total (one cumulative final) plus easy online assignments. He gives in class assignments once a week for a participation grade and writes his lecture notes in class so go to class. Study the in-class assignments for your test. I would 100% take again.

Professor Tsay is such a nice guy. The course is a bit difficult, but it would be with any professor. He is hard to understand at first but you get used to it after a couple of weeks. He gives so many opportunities for extra credit. Go to class. I'm taking him again for ACCT 2200.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Tsay was a difficult teacher. The way he teaches was all over the place and hard to follow. Every other week there is a graded class assignment. Tests are somewhat difficult but gives you practice test questions that help. He is a nice person but not the best professor. Also, he doesn't believe in curving tests but gives extra credit.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: He tries to explain the material, but it gets very confusing. He basically just reads from the slides and doesn't really explain how to do the problems. I asked for help and didn't receive any.  I would definitely recommend taking Stephanie Miller instead. Its a tough class either way, but she is better.

I would say the class in general is a more difficult class, maybe not necessarily his fault. It was a little difficult for me to follow along in is lectures, but he at least makes a really good effort to teach you the material.

He wrote the textbook so his teachings go right along with it. Connect website has a hw assignment and quiz due weekly. Attendance: A 5 minute in class assignment about once a week. 10 total and you need 5 for a 100% participation grade. Other than that, a midterm & final! I'd say the class was an easy B if you come to class & do Connect.

This class is difficult. He's not good at explaining things in lecture and rambles. Homework takes forever. My biggest complaint is that he doesn't teach us how to apply principles, which is necessary to doing well on the test. he is good at explaining over e-mail though! be ready to teach yourself.

Nice guy, but not very good when it comes to teaching. Very unclear and is all over the place. Lectures are very boring. The homework takes forever and he only gives 2 tests and a final. You pretty much have to teach yourself and read the book. You have to put in A LOT of effort if you want a good grade. Would not take again.

Great professor and very knowledgeable with Ph.D. and CPA and years of experience.  Read the textbook and do all of the end of chapter problems if you want to learn.  Professor responds immediately to emails, answers all questions, and provides detailed Excel Spreadsheets with formulas in cells if you ask.  Excellent. Highly recommend him.

Great Professor.  Extremely knowledgeable and helpful by providing detailed Excel Spreadsheets with instructive answers to your questions and provides formulas.  You will learn a lot from him by putting a lot of effort reading the textbook working all end of chapter problem, even those that are not assigned.  He responds immediately to emails.

Online course w/ clear expectations He assigned homework which was graded based on effort, not accuracy. We had discussions & very interesting additional reading which was quizzed. You're able to move through course at own pace other than exams. Course was broken down in small sections which was helpful. Great with email.
